STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 7, 2022
Stella Daniels
St Clair County DHHS
220 Fort St
Port Huron, MI 48060
RE: License #: CP740201421
St Clair County DHHS
220 Fort St
Port Huron, MI 48060
Dear Ms. Daniels:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 07/06/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure
Jamie Reinke
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
In one out of eight foster children records reviewed, one
updated service plan dated 08/19/2021 – 11/16/2021 was
generated 11/17/2021, 1 day late.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans.
Agreement and Signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must obtain
signatures from the following individuals, as applicable:
 Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated
court ordered caregivers.
The caseworker must obtain signatures from all applicable
individuals and upload the signatures pages into the
electronic case record within 30 days of the report date.
Seven of twenty - three service plans reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One Youth 11/23/2021 – 12/20/2021 treatment plan,
approved 12/20/2021, was not signed by the caregiver or
4

the Youth. Same Youth report 12/21/2021 – 03/19/2021
approved 03/19/2022 was not signed by the Youth or
caregiver.
 A second Youth report 11/07/2021 – 02/14/2022
approved 02/14/2022 treatment plan was not signed by
the caregiver.
 A third Youth treatment plan 11/17/2021 – 02/14/2022
approved on 02/14/2022, was uploaded on 06/26/2022.
This report was pass the 30 days for signature.
 A fourth Youth report 07/01/2021 – 07/30/2021 approved
10/13/2021 was pass the 30 days allotted for the
signature. Same Youth report 07/31/2021 – 10/27/2021
had no signature from the Youth or caregiver.
FOM 722-8E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary.
Completion Requirements:
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MiSACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
change.
 Within three business days of foster care or juvenile
justice program or case closure.
One of three closed independent living records reviewed did not
show that the DHHS-69 was completed within three business
days.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport.
Updated Medical Passport:
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
 Participating legal parents, if the child is a temporary
court ward; Quarterly, while in out-of-home
placement; and at reunification.
 The child’s foster care provider: At or prior to each
placement and Quarterly.
Two of six open foster child records reviewed did not show
consistent documentation that the medical passport was
5

completed quarterly and provided to the caregiver or birth
parent. One foster child had no medical passport uploaded.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R400.12409 Education policy
It is suggested that the youth report cards or performance documents are uploaded
in MiSACWIS.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation:
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were one incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency had an incident of alleged physical abuse by an adult household member
towards a foster child. The foster home was in violation with R9201 Foster parent
qualifications and R9202 Member of household qualifications. The agency
recommended revocation of the foster home license due to the willful and substantial
violations.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency received a special investigation on 03/04/2022, SI#2022C0201010
regarding failure to report. The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action
plan and is following the corrective action plan.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan with their renewal
inspection on 04/14/2021. The agency was in violation with Rules 312 (4), 418 (a),
418 (b), 418 (6), FOM 722-8C and FOM 722-09. The agency is following their
corrective action plan.
Vl. DCWL ANALYST FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS:
There were no identified safety concerns.
6

VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommended that St. Clair County DHHS
continue on a regular license.
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 7, 2022
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
